title: The Origins of ‘Impeach’: From Ensnared Feet to Accusations of High Crimes
text:
“You’ll never guess our top search right now,” teased Merriam-Webster’s Twitter account on Tuesday evening. The word driving look-ups in the online dictionary was “impeach”—unsurprising given that this was soon after Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s announcement that the House of Representatives would be pursuing an official impeachment inquiry of President Trump. Merriam-Webster reported its search rate for “impeach” jumped by a factor of 36.

Some of those searches were no doubt inspired by longstanding confusion about the meaning...
description: The term’s long evolution has involved many rival meanings, and now it’s often taken to mean not just “investigate” but “convict.”
